meanings.definition: A line on a map marking the boundary between areas where different linguistic features are used.
meanings.sent1: The isogloss on the map shows where the language changes.
meanings.sent2: Linguists study isoglosses to understand language variations.
meanings.sent3: The isogloss danced across the map, separating the regions.
meanings.sent4: The isogloss acted like a fence, keeping the linguistic differences apart.
meanings.sent5: The bright red isogloss stood out on the map, like a bold line between languages.

meanings.definition: A line on a map marking the boundary between areas where different dialects are spoken.
meanings.sent1: People living on either side of the isogloss speak different dialects.
meanings.sent2: The isogloss helps linguists identify dialect regions.
meanings.sent3: The isogloss played hide and seek on the map, teasing the dialects.
meanings.sent4: The isogloss was like a bridge connecting two dialect worlds.
meanings.sent5: The isogloss was like a colorful ribbon on the map, separating dialects clearly.
